triples.o: sharp jump in attenuation around 50 keV

evidence: contrast agents take advantage of the K-edge effect
iodine, gadolinium, and gold have sharp jumps in attenuation
spectral CT can unlock these curves and make imaging chemically specific
iodine is the most common CT contrast agent
gadolinium can also be detected in spectral CT
gold nanoparticles are being investigated for advanced applications

concepts.term: spectral CT can unlock these curves

evidence: Now let's look at how contrast agents take advantage of the K-edge effect we just discussed.
gadolinium, which is widely used in MRI, can also be detected in spectral CT
